Course Link: The direct URL to the course page. Do not include any additional information or text.
Course Title: The complete title of the course along with its level, if available (e.g., 'MSc in Computer Science Level 9'). Write degree level in the name first and then add degree name like BS Accoounting not Accoounting BS If the title is not explicitly stated, summarize it based on the available text. If no title can be derived, use 'NA'.
Required IELTS Score: The minimum IELTS score required for the course, specifying the overall score and, if applicable, the minimum scores for each section (e.g., 'Overall: 6.5, Reading: 6.0'). If only the overall score is provided, include that. If no score is mentioned, indicate 'NA'.
Required PTE Score: The minimum PTE score required for the course, including the overall score and any minimum scores for individual sections, if specified (e.g., 'Overall: 58, Writing: 54'). If only the overall score is given, include that. If this information is not found, mark it as 'NA'.
Required TOEFL Score: The required TOEFL score for the course, detailing the overall score and any minimum section scores available (e.g., 'Overall: 80, Speaking: 20'). If only the overall score is provided, include that. If the information is not available, write 'NA'.
Entry Requirement: A detailed summary of the qualifications needed for admission (minimum 100 words), including standardized test scores such as GCE A Levels, International Baccalaureate, GRE, GMAT, or other specific such tests. Mention any specific subject requirements and general educational qualifications. Ensure the summary is concise and informative. Specifically menstion any information related to the Pakistan or is under Pakistan Requirements Heading.
Education Level: Specify the level of education appropriate for the course, choosing from 'Undergraduate', 'Master', or 'PhD'. If not directly stated, deduce from the context of the provided information.
Course Level: Indicate the academic level of the course, selecting from 'Bachelor', 'Master', 'PhD', 'Diploma', 'Major', 'Certificate', 'Foundational Course', 'Pathway', or 'Specialisation'. If this is not explicitly mentioned, determine it from the content or indicate 'NA'.
Intake: The next available enrollment period or year for the course. If not mentioned in the text, infer from context or write 'NA'.
Duration: Total duration of the course in years (e.g., '1 Year', '2 Years'). If the duration is not directly available, deduce from the context and summarize appropriately or write 'NA'.
Start Date: The exact start date or commencement date of the course. If not specified, summarize from the available text or write 'NA'.
Degree Format: The method of course delivery, choosing from 'On Campus', 'Online', or 'Blended'. If the format is not explicitly mentioned, infer it from the course description or write 'NA'.
Location/Campus: The physical location or campus where the course is offered. This can include a specific campus name (e.g., 'Main Campus') or the city where it is located (e.g., 'New York City'). If the location is not clearly stated, attempt to deduce it from related information. If no location can be identified, write 'NA'.
Annual Tuition Fee: The yearly tuition cost for the course specifically for international students in the 2025/26 academic year, detailing both Full-time and Part-time in a single line. Write the fees in the respective currency. If not mentioned, mark it as 'NA'.
Initial Deposit: The required initial fee for admission to the course. If not applicable, indicate the fee in the respective currency or write 'NA'.
Application Fee: The application fee required to apply for the course. If this fee is not applicable, indicate the fee in the respective currency or write 'NA'.
Overview: A brief overview (300-400 words) summarizing what the course or degree entails, highlighting key topics, objectives, and educational outcomes. This should provide a clear picture of the course without copying any text directly.
Course Structure: An outline of the curriculum structure (300-400 words), detailing the series of courses and educational content required to complete the program. Mention specific subjects if provided, or summarize the general course outline.
Year 1: A paragraph (200-250 words) summarizing the content and subjects covered in the first year of the course. If the information is not structured this way in the provided text, summarize accordingly while ensuring key subjects are mentioned. If the degree is shorter than one year, leave this field as 'NA'.
Year 2: A paragraph (200-250 words) summarizing the content and subjects covered in the second year of the course. Summarize the information provided or construct content from your knowledge, ensuring to meet the required word count. If the degree is shorter than two years, leave this field as 'NA'.
Year 3: A paragraph (200-250 words) summarizing the content and subjects covered in the third year of the course. If not provided in a structured format, summarize the relevant content or construct knowledge-based content, maintaining the word count. If the degree is shorter than three years, leave this field as 'NA'.
Year 4: A paragraph (200-250 words) summarizing the content and subjects covered in the fourth year of the course. If the text is not structured this way, summarize appropriately while ensuring to cover key topics. If the degree is shorter than four years, leave this field as 'NA'.
Year 5: A paragraph (200-250 words) summarizing the content and subjects studied in the fifth year, if applicable. If the text does not provide structured information, summarize accordingly. If the degree is shorter than five years, leave this field as 'NA'.
Year 6: A paragraph (200-250 words) summarizing the content and subjects studied in the sixth year, if applicable. If no structured information is available, summarize based on provided details. If the degree is shorter than six years, leave this field as 'NA'.
Career Opportunity 1: The first potential job title or career opportunity associated with the program. If not available, deduce from related fields or general knowledge and provide one relevant title.
Career Opportunity 2: The second potential job title or career opportunity related to the program. If no title is available, provide a relevant one based on knowledge.
Career Opportunity 3: The third potential job title or career opportunity associated with the program. If not available, deduce from general knowledge and provide one title.
Career Opportunity 4: The fourth potential job title or career opportunity associated with the program. If no title is available, provide a relevant one based on knowledge.
Career Opportunity 5: The fifth potential job title or career opportunity related to the program. If not available, deduce from general knowledge and provide one title.
